title: Fear Bomb
contents: text | As an action you can throw the bomb up to 60 feet. All creatures within 5 feet of impact must make a dc 11 Wis save or be frightened for 1 minute.
text| Creatures affected by this can repeat the saving throw at the end of their turn.

title: Bagpipes of Invisibility
contents: property | Recharge | 10 seconds  of genuine applause recharges one charge
text | You are invisible to creatures that hear you play the bagpipe. Each minute you use the bagpipe in this way causes the bagpipes to lose 1 charge.

title: Everything thrower
contents: text | This backpack weighs 20 kilo's and function like a flamethrower but for everything. You can use it as an action by pouring the respective material into the backpack and aiming the hose. Below are some examples.
property | Alchemists Fire | Creatures in a 15-foot cone are affected as if by an alchemists fire.
property | Acid | Creatures in a 15-foot cone takes 2d6 acid damage.
property | Caltrops | Creatures in a 15-foot cone take 2d6 piercing damage.

title: Ring of Kamikaze
contents: description | Spell | Once per day, recharging at dawn, you can use an action to cast fireball (dc 13) centered on your location.

title: Boots of Blinding Speed
contents: text | You can click the heels of the boots and expend 1 charge to gain the effect of the Haste spell until the start of your next turn.
text | You are also blinded until the start of your next turn.

title: Bracers of Mirror Daggers
contents: text | Whenever you use an attack to throw a dagger you can expend a charge to create several illusory daggers that fly with it. This grants advantage on the attack unless the target can see through illusions.

title: Quiver of Curse
contents: text | This quiver has unlimited arrows.

text | When you hit a creature with an arrow from this quiver you can choose to spend a charge to have that creature be the target of a Bane spell with a DC of 8 + your prof bonus + your wisdom bonus.

title: Cloak of Elvenkind
contents: text | While you wear with the hood up you gain the following effects:
bullet | You have advantage on stealth checks
bullet | You have disadvantage on perception checks

title: Eyes of the Eagle
contents: text | These glasses grant the wielder advantage on Perception checks. In condition of clear visibility, you can make out details of objects up to 2 miles far.

title: Periapt of Wound Closure
contents: text | While wearing this pendant, you stabilize whenever you are dying at the start of your turn.
text | In addition, whenever you roll Hit Die to regain hit points, double the number of hit points restored.

title: Sending Stones
contents: text | You can use one stone to cast the spell Sending , targeting the owner of the other stone.
text | The stone can't be used until the next dawn.

title: Wand of the Warmage, +1
contents: text | You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you ignore half cover when making a spell attack.
text | Whenever you make a concentration saving throw, you can expend a charge to gain advantage on the roll.

title: Dwarven Warhammer
contents: text | You have a +1 on attack and damage rolls with this hammer.
text | You have advantage on Perception and Investigation checks to find traps and secret doors in stone.

title: Rapier of Glamour
contents: property | Attunement | with prof. in performance.
text | As a reaction to being hit by a melee attack, you can expend one charge to add your charisma bonus to your AC for that attack, perhaps causing the attack to miss.
text | This does not work against creatures that are immune to the charmed condition.

title: Curse of the Fates
contents: text | Whenever you curse a creature, either with a spell or a class feature, you can also choose to affect the creature with the Compelled Duel spell.

title: Ring of the Fire Adapt
contents: property | attunement | abilty to cast a spell
text | You gain the benefit of the Elemental Adapt feat (fire):
bullet | Spells you cast that deal fire damage ignore resistance.
bullet | When you roll damage for a spell that deals fire damage, you can treat any 1 on a damage die as a 2.
